page.title: 11Unemployment
page.content: Unemployment in the Kidderminster area has shown a small improvement of 130 during the last month. The latest Job Centre figures for June 1985 show that 5517 people are still without a job (15.2% of the area's working population). This compares with 16% for Birmingham and 11.5% for Worcester. The improvement is probably only seasonal and the prospects are not good. The area relied heavily on the{carpet industry}which has been severely cut back.{ Farming}has become more mechanised, resulting in more job losses from the land. People who are unemployed receive a certain amount of money each week known as 'the dole' (Unemployment Benefit) from the state. People who have retired also receive a weekly sum of money (pension).
